pages.text: The Beehive Oven acts as an in-world furnace. Only a couple recipes work however. And some blocks are only able to be cooked over long periods of time in the oven. *Supports datapacks.

pages.title: Current Conversions
pages.text: See JEI for a comprehensive list. $(li)Subbituminous Coal --> Bituminous Coal   $(li)Bituminous coal --> Coke   $(li)Limestone --> Quicklime   $(li)Magnesite --> Magnesia   $(li)Bone Block --> Bone Char   $(li)Kaolinite --> Porcelain   $(li)Clay --> Terracotta   $(li)Colored Terracotta --> Glazed Terracotta
See next page for minimum structure. The pit converts blocks one at a time based off random ticks. Can be upgraded to work faster. Blaze powder can be clicked on the pit to instantly cook one block.

$(mechanics/fire)Light$() the pit to activate. It will cook the blocks on the outer ring two blocks high (16 blocks total). The pit deactivates when no cookable blocks are detected. The structure can be expanded to the size on the next page. The more complete the structure is, the faster the process is. The pit can be upgraded to allow for higher tier refractory bricks to be used in the structure.
Allows for the use of high refracroy bricks to increase speed. Must upgrade the surrounding 8 bricks to use.
Allows for the use of ultra high refracroy bricks to cook multiple blocks at once. Must upgrade the surrounding 8 bricks to use.
